CS110FinalProject

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • CS110FinalProject.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a game. Can be ran (has a main method, a CLI interface to the game) but also can be used to implement another interface, such as a GUI.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Game.StepGameState
      Used for keeping track of the game's state when using the step() method

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()

      • deal

        public void deal()
        Deals the cards.

      • playerTopCard

        public Card playerTopCard()
        Peeks at the player's top card.
        Returns:
        null if there is no top card, otherwise returns the top card on the player's pile.

      • computerTopCard

        public Card computerTopCard()
        Peeks at the computer's top card.
        Returns:
        null if there is no top card, otherwise returns the top card on the computer's pile.

      • playerHandSize

        public int playerHandSize()
        Gets the size of the player's hand.
        Returns:
        The size of the player's hand.

      • computerHandSize

        public int computerHandSize()
        Gets the size of the computer's hand.
        Returns:
        The size of the computer's hand.

      • flip

        public void flip()
        Flip the top card from both the player and the computer's deck. This is the first part of a new turn, or part of a war.

      • getWinState

        public int getWinState()
        Gets the state of the game based on the current top two cards.
        Returns:
        a negative number if the computer won, 0 if a war needs to be played, a positive number if the player won.

      • getGameState

        public int getGameState()
        Gets the state of the game.
        Returns:
        A negative number if the computer won, 0 if the game is still going on, a positive number if the player won.

      • processTurn

        public int processTurn()
        Processes a turn. Should be called directly after flip(). Does NOT handle wars. To handle wars, check if this method returned 0 and call the method war().
        Returns:
        a negative number if the computer won, 0 if a war needs to be played, a positive number if the player won.

      • war

        public boolean war()
        Processes a war.
        Returns:
        true if the war was successful and decided a winner, false if the war needs to be done again.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • step

        public boolean step()
        Steps a game. Updates the values returned by Game.getStatusMessage() and Game.getSteppedGameState().
        Returns:
        True if the game is over, false if the game is still going on.

      • getStatusMessage

        public java.lang.String getStatusMessage()

      • getStepGameState

        public Game.StepGameState getStepGameState()
        Gets the current state of the stepped game.
        Returns:
        an enum representing the state of the game (Game.StepGameState). Can be normal, cardJustPlayed, gameOver, or war.
